about_the_game:
"Maybe, just maybe, there are some things to live for."

"But at the same time, does any of this really matter? When I die, I'll forget this all anyway."

Slumberer's Universe is the story of a grieving middle schooler struggling to cope with loss.

Months have passed since Alph's best friend Walter died in a car accident. Alph's been trying to overcome his death, but there's always something that reminds him of the horror and sadness of it. One day, one specific remaining of Walter set a series of life-changing moments in motion. Everything started to change—mostly for the worse. As Alph struggles to understand the universe's new form, he faces unsettling questions: What is Walter’s connection to the universe? And why is Alph the only one who seems to notice the growing darkness?

Solve the mysteries and find out the truth about the universe, while trying to overcome your friend's death in this heart-wrenching psychological horror RPG! Slumberer's Universe is not just a story about grief—it's a chilling exploration of existence itself, where the line between "what's it to live" and "what's it to die" begins to blur.

And maybe, just maybe, find a reason to keep on living. The fate is still unclear.

Key features:

  • A gripping and heartfelt story about suicide and death, and their consequences.

  • A unique turn-based-meets-action battle system that's been praised by players!

  • Original visual / art style

  • And the story, of course. That's the main thing.

content_descriptors.notes: This game contains suicide, self-harm and death, and may not be suitable for everyone.
